s.text: But it's simply not true, as Jodie T. Allen asserts in her introduction, that the
If so, I'd suggest he attend a future race and talk to some of his section-mates.
Second, it is exciting and even encouraging to watch one's hero smack a concrete wall at such high speeds and walk away unscathed.
Did Stevenson speak with any of the fans with whose hopes he claimed to be so familiar?
Did Stevenson speak with any of the fans with whose hopes he claimed to be so familiar?
Virtually all the fans with whom I have spoken over the years (quite a friendly bunch, actually) consider the absence of big wrecks, injuries, etc., a key component of a good race.
